Operation 'get-/marketing/v3/transactional/smtp-tokens_getTokensPage' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original description is unclear about pagination support and return format. Summary doesn't indicate this is a retrieval/query operation. Added clarity about pagination, return type, and the distinction between filtering by campaign name (multiple results) versus emailCampaignId (single result) to help AI agents understand filtering behavior and response structure.

data.current_summary: Query SMTP API tokens by campaign name or an emailCampaignId.
data.current_description: Query multiple SMTP API tokens by campaign name or a single token by emailCampaignId.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve SMTP API tokens with filtering options
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve SMTP API tokens with optional filtering by campaign name or emailCampaignId. Supports pagination through forward paging parameters. Returns a collection of SmtpApiTokenView objects containing token ID and password credentials for SMTP authentication. Use campaign name to retrieve multiple tokens or emailCampaignId to retrieve a single token.
data.reasoning: Original description is unclear about pagination support and return format. Summary doesn't indicate this is a retrieval/query operation. Added clarity about pagination, return type, and the distinction between filtering by campaign name (multiple results) versus emailCampaignId (single result) to help AI agents understand filtering behavior and response structure.

message: Operation 'post-/marketing/v3/transactional/smtp-tokens_createToken' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary and description are identical and lack specificity. Missing details about what inputs are required, what the response contains, and the critical side effect that credentials must be stored immediately. Enhanced version clarifies the purpose, input/output schemas, and the security implication that credentials are only returned once.

data.summary_suggestion: Create a new SMTP API token for email sending
data.description_suggestion: Create a new SMTP API token for sending transactional emails via the HubSpot SMTP API. Accepts a SmtpApiTokenRequestEgg object with token configuration. Returns a SmtpApiTokenView containing the generated token ID and password credentials. The returned credentials must be securely stored as they are required for SMTP authentication and cannot be retrieved later.
data.reasoning: Original summary and description are identical and lack specificity. Missing details about what inputs are required, what the response contains, and the critical side effect that credentials must be stored immediately. Enhanced version clarifies the purpose, input/output schemas, and the security implication that credentials are only returned once.

message: Operation 'delete-/marketing/v3/transactional/smtp-tokens/{tokenId}_archiveToken' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_side_effects, inconsistent_terminology. Original summary uses 'Delete' but operation is named 'archiveToken', indicating the actual behavior is archival/disabling rather than deletion. Description lacks critical side effect information about token invalidation and impact on dependent applications. Enhanced version uses consistent terminology ('archive'), clarifies the permanent nature of the action, and explains the consequences for AI agents to understand the severity of this operation.

data.current_summary: Delete a single token by ID.
data.current_description: Delete a single token by ID.
data.summary_suggestion: Archive and disable an SMTP API token
data.description_suggestion: Archive and disable a single SMTP API token by its ID. Once archived, the token can no longer be used for SMTP authentication. This action is permanent and cannot be undone. Any applications using this token will lose the ability to send emails through the SMTP API.
data.reasoning: Original summary uses 'Delete' but operation is named 'archiveToken', indicating the actual behavior is archival/disabling rather than deletion. Description lacks critical side effect information about token invalidation and impact on dependent applications. Enhanced version uses consistent terminology ('archive'), clarifies the permanent nature of the action, and explains the consequences for AI agents to understand the severity of this operation.
